message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR 

The paper discusses the use of convolutional neural networks (CNNs) for the detection and identification of extreme weather events in large-scale climate simulations. This involves the use of spatiotemporal data and exploratory data analysis, which are common topics in computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG) research. The paper also discusses the use of semi-supervised learning, which is a common topic in natural language processing (cs.CL) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI) research. Finally, the paper discusses the use of a new dataset, which could be of interest to researchers in information retrieval (cs.IR) who are interested in climate data.
